intro: Anthaenantiopsis racemosa, commonly known as the clustered starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other genera such as *Impatiens* and *Hibiscus*. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with a fine layer of white hairs. Anthaenantiopsis racemosa is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
